overview.title: What this blend is
overview.text: GLOW bundles three peptides that each address a different step in the tissue repair cascade. BPC-157 drives angiogenesis — the formation of new blood vessels that supply the injury site. TB-500 mobilizes cells into that vascularized area to rebuild the extracellular matrix. GHK-Cu provides the collagen synthesis signal and anti-inflammatory support that sustains the process. The combination is designed for broader regenerative coverage than any single compound provides, which is why it's a popular choice for soft tissue recovery and skin health.

use_cases.title: Use cases (real-world)
use_cases.text: Use cases are framed as intent + context, not as a recommendation.
People usually consider blends when they’re trying to simplify decision-making, stack fewer vials, or chase a combined effect profile. The downside is more moving parts and more uncertainty.
If one component would be a bad fit for you (meds, history, side effects), the blend is also a bad fit — even if the other component seems appealing.

interaction_summary.title: Interaction summary
interaction_summary.text: Interaction flags are category prompts — not dosing instructions.
Blends inherit interaction risk from every component. If one component has a meaningful interaction class, treat the blend as having that interaction class.
If you’re on prescription meds (especially cardio, anticoagulant/antiplatelet, serotonergic, immunomodulating), treat uncertainty as a reason to slow down and verify with a clinician.

blend.rationale: GLOW bundles three peptides that each address a different step in the tissue repair cascade. BPC-157 drives angiogenesis — the formation of new blood vessels that supply the injury site. TB-500 mobilizes cells into that vascularized area to rebuild the extracellular matrix. GHK-Cu provides the collagen synthesis signal and anti-inflammatory support that sustains the process. The combination is designed for broader regenerative coverage than any single compound provides, which is why it's a popular choice for soft tissue recovery and skin health.
blend.synergy_note: The three mechanisms are sequential and complementary: BPC-157 opens the blood supply, TB-500 populates the area with repair cells, GHK-Cu drives the collagen rebuilding that consolidates the repair. Each compound addresses a stage the others don't.
blend.who_its_for: Athletes recovering from soft tissue injuries, post-surgical healing, anyone targeting skin and connective tissue alongside systemic repair.

component_roles.bpc-157: Angiogenesis driver — promotes new blood vessel formation at the injury site and protects GI tissue
component_roles.tb-500: Systemic remodeler — mobilizes cells into the injury site and drives extracellular matrix rebuilding throughout the body
component_roles.ghk-cu: Collagen signal — stimulates collagen and elastin synthesis, modulates inflammation throughout the repair process
